Class PDMS

java.lang.Object
schedulingAlgorithm.PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm
schedulingAlgorithm.PartitionedSchedulingAlgorithm
schedulingAlgorithm.implementation.PDMS
public class PDMS extends PartitionedSchedulingAlgorithm
Partitioned implementation of the DMS scheduler.

This class represents a partitioned scheduling algorithm that assigns the Distributed Minimum Slack (DMS) local scheduling algorithm to each core. The original file included a short description: "Partitioned DMS.", which is preserved and expanded here to explain the class responsibility.

Author:
ShiuJia

  • Constructor Details

    • PDMS

      public PDMS()
      Constructs a new PDMS instance.

      Initializes the algorithm name to "Partitioned DMS". This mirrors the original constructor behavior which set the display name for this partitioned scheduling algorithm.

  • Method Details

    • setCoresLocalSchedulingAlgorithm

      public void setCoresLocalSchedulingAlgorithm(Vector<Core> cores)
      Assigns the local scheduling algorithm for each core to a new DMS instance.

      This method iterates over the provided cores collection and sets each core's local scheduler using c.setLocalSchedAlgorithm(new DMS()). It integrates the original implementation intent: every core in the partitioned scheduler should use DMS as its local scheduling algorithm.

      Specified by:
      setCoresLocalSchedulingAlgorithm in class PartitionedSchedulingAlgorithm
      Parameters:
      cores - a Vector of Core objects whose local scheduling algorithm will be set; must not be null. Each element in the vector will receive a new DMS instance.
